metadata.Name: Russian Jeopardy!
metadata.Description: A large-scale Russian dataset for question-answering systems, based on questions from the Russian version of the TV show Jeopardy! (Svoya Igra). It contains over 210,000 question-answer pairs, split into training, development, and test sets.
Provider: National Research University Higher School of Economics
metadata.Paper Title: A Russian Jeopardy! Data Set for Question-Answering Systems
metadata.Venue Title: Proceedings of the Tenth International Conference on Language Resources and Evaluation (LREC 2016)
metadata.Venue Name: Tenth International Conference on Language Resources and Evaluation
Affiliations: National Research University Higher School of Economics
metadata.Abstract: This paper presents a new large-scale Russian data set for the evaluation of question-answering systems. The data set is based on questions from the Russian version of the TV show Jeopardy!, called Svoya Igra. The current version of the data set contains 210,522 question-answer pairs. We provide a predefined split of the data set into training, development, and test sets. The data set is freely available for research purposes. We present a baseline system for factoid question answering based on a search engine. The system achieves the precision at 1 (P@1) of 39.8% on the presented data set. We hope that this data set will foster research in the area of Russian question answering.
